events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car on the main highway resulting in moderate damage.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing initial details provided by the insured.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to the case to assist the customer with further process steps.
The customer received confirmation that their claim had been acknowledged and was under active review.
Requested police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license for verification.
The customer submitted all requested documentation including accident report and medical evaluations.
Investigation began focusing on liability, extent of vehicle damage, and verification of submitted documents.
Investigation completed confirming the insured was not at fault; damage estimates were consistent.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover vehicle repairs fully, including rental car expenses.
Customer provided positive feedback appreciating the timely responses and clear communication.
Claim was approved following customer acceptance of the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for repair costs and additional expenses was issued successfully to the customer’s account.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that all procedures and payments were completed.
